column5: HI ALL  I can see some good tread about kayak fishing in here..  this is great news.  .  I have been hook on kayak fishing since i got myself in one and went fishing...i alwasy been in love wit canoe fishing ,,still are but now i am realy hook on kayak fishing.   here in the ottawa regions we have tons off great place to go yaking around and catch all species.  here my yak..

its would be nice to see how many fish frome kayak in here...?  we got a cople guys around ottawa that do so..and we start to have some group kayak outhings and its been fun.  .  here some yak fishing pict.
here's one pict off our first little group outhing..  cople kayak on shore in the morning before blast off..
Damn, Those are some sweet setups Joco.  You've got everything on yours by the looks of it.
welcome Joco!!! see you on the water soon! going tomorrow

hi tbayboy....   my yak is a wilderness 135t..a 2 persons kayak tranform in a one person ,,that way it guive me a LOT off space for all my tackle etc.  i got on that kayak.  on the front dash board...fish finder gps compass 2 rod holder...movable forward and backward digital camera month and a digital for self pict..  in the yak.......2 rods tackle box whit 4 plano box full off tackle. maps safety kit spare padle drift bag anker+rope/shain emergency kit an electric builg pump. an hand builg pump a sponge all the tools..plyer cuters etc,.  on the kayak............safety flag for the boaters to see me better on the side a rope on 2 pulleys to make the anker or drift systeme to go forwar or backward. a post for still fishing in the shalows.    plus i got in my truck.safety light for front and back if i go night fishing..plus a little clip on down riger in case i go lakers or something.   so not mutch is missing for now i would think..all off this ad 50 pound its not to bad..the kayak can handle 500 pound.    hope to see more and more kayak fishermans..and report   joco.
crazzyhook......   will be on th jock at........6am.   hope to have a report...for here.......ok i will have one..   wen the kayak crazzyhook......?   joco.
hi tbayboy...  one more pict deferent view..
That is one seriously pimped out yak my man. I had a rod holder on mine, but took it off to make room for a camera mount.  Now I can back up my fish tales with photographic evidence.
Wow, nice kayak. It looks fully decked out. Do the big fish give you a nice ride?
Hey Joco, good to see you will b e sharing your reports on here now.  Have you explained your writing yet?  Just kidding.  I always look forward to your reports and your kayak is the ultimate.  Don
Here's my 14' Old Town "Twin Otter" at Lakeview Lagoon...  http://smg.photobucket.com/albums/v316/drr...nt=IM000497.jpg
Here's me Mum in my old 11' Breeze by Aqua Fusion...  http://smg.photobucket.com/albums/v316/drr...nt=IM000490.jpg

hey badger..you say..Have you explained your writing yet?  whats wrong wit the writhing.......  its frenglish..  i do have some prob to translate...but the guys do understand...i hope..  .  but if ever people have probleme writh the writhing,,,,just re read all the tread,,,,it should get in after a wild.....  . its some kind off puzzle.  joco.
reports are great joco! I will call you today, I have something in the works that I think you might enjoy...

Thanks for the details joco - I looked up the model from one of the pics (where I could see it) and realized it was a tandem that you modified.  Nice idea, certainly gives you lots of room.  I've always enjoyed the yak reports on this board and look forward to more of yours (I'd buy one but I'm waiting to figure out my next house move before purchasing a canoe/yak/boat).
That is one seriously pimped out kayak ! I just hope that you never tip that thing coz that's alot of expensive gear to lose !  How do you transport such a large kayak to and from the lake ?

hi grilw..  if i ever flip...  i dont care mutch...everything is attche to the kayak wit a leash,,rods all the stuff in the box...the box as some flaothing devise it wont sink.  the only probleme will be the water in the digital and the fish finder....th gps is water proof...thatr is why i got a use fish finder and use digital on the net at a real sheap price that way,,i flip........dont loose mutch.  but to flip.man you almaost nee d to want to flip,,there hard to flip.   joco.
Here is a post from a pioneer, small video too.....  http://www.billsbaitandtackle.ca/modules.p...topic&t=370
Nice setup!
Silent (b)assassins!  Fish beware  -Sawyer

Right on !!!!!!!!   you have your boat rigged out very nice,and by looking at those fish,i would say it works very good....and you sure can go where other types of boats cant,like small rivers & lakes....that would be a blast in alqonquain park thats for sure.....great idea...cheers
